intro: Seseli dolichostyla, commonly known as the long-styled seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stem and compound umbel-shaped inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. Its flowers are small and white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Seseli dolichostyla is often found in open habitats such as meadows and along stream banks.
